name: Bali Pulina
address: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja No.Br, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: Great stop if you're in this area! The coffee sampler is only 65K and fun to try, although the coffee they use is from powder. The ice cream looks pretty but tastes pretty processed. However, the view is astounding!
review 2: Pelayanan super ramah, semalem perkebunan kopi yes, roastery also yes, serving gear coffee like definitely, they also fermenting coffee to another level you cant imagine. you can see musang here also and an old technique to roastering coffee. what a great place.
review 3: We loved the place. Ari was amazing guide. We tried 5 different aromatic coffees and of course luwac coffee. It was an great experience for us. Definitely one of the must to go places in Bali.
review 4: It's a nice place where you can experience Luwak coffee and be welcomed with a small tour of the production stages. Its natural pool and hanging iron bridge create a beautiful atmosphere. However, my only bad criticism is; The animals in this and all similar places are locked in small cages or neutralized with sedatives for display. This use of animals in general destroyed my interest in this coffee in general and this was the last time I drank it…
review 5: I just went in to taste Lowak coffee. Staff was friendly and showed me their civets and coffee making process. The have different options for tasting their tea and coffees. You can buy their products in the shop.

name: Abian Desa Rice Terrace
address: Jalan Raya Banjar Jl. Pakudui, Kedisan, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: It was a really cool experience to see a rice terrace like that live. The whole irrigation system is incredible, the fact that all the terraces have the same amount of water from top to bottom. I'd love to come back.
review 2: Ambian Desa Rice Terrace offers breathtaking views of Bali's lush landscapes. The terraced fields provide a stunning backdrop for photography enthusiasts. However, the area can get crowded with tourists, diminishing the tranquility. Overall, a must-visit for its natural beauty, but be prepared for the crowds.
review 3:
📍🌸

A rice terrace, hidden and serene, 🌾🌟
Not too touristy, a tranquil scene. 🚶‍♂️🌟

Nice to walk around, soak in the view, 🚶‍♀️🌄
Surrounded by streets full of rattan, wood, crafts anew. 🏞️🎋

AJ suggests a thought, a visitor's plea, 💡❤️
More information on special features, you see. 🌟📚

Share the lives of local farmers, their toil, 🌾👨‍🌾
The stories behind the fields, rich soil. 🌟🌾

📍🌸
review 4:
Overall the view is nice but you get the see the rice terrace along the stretch of cafes available. Most of them are extortionists due to the price.

This place was also expensive but we paid anyway because we needed some activity to feel like we made the most out of the day.

We had to pay 50k entrance (2pax) just to go into the area. They prefer cash over card. Using card would have incurred additional 3% fees, they said

Then another 700k for the zip line across the rice terrace. It was an experience but also honestly the excitement from the zip line would probably take away the excitement of the view. The view can be appreciated peacefully.

Their safety harness is smelly and dirty. No sanitation so if that is your biggest pet peeve, then the activity is not for you. No hair net whatsoever for the helmet. It stinks even after you remove it. There is also a weight/size limit on the activities like tandem bike, superman swing etc. the Harness need to fit before you can pay for the activity. Overall, it’s very touristy. Like drivers literally bring their passengers there as one of the pit stop.

We came from tis cafe so we walked and then walked back to tis cafe to enjoy the view!
review 5: For me the best rice terraces in Tegalalang. You just have to hang on and not go to the first two very exposed places and get here. Although you can also find typical tourist attractions like swings and hanging railways, there are far fewer people here 👍

name: D Alas Warung Restaurant
address: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: We had such an enjoyable lunch here. The staff is phenomenal. Made everyone in our large tour feel like family. We enjoyed all of the food. The duck was amazing. They have a variety of local food options along with other options suitable for vegan guests. The drinks are also very good. It is an amazing location with great views and even swings and a pool on the same property!
review 2: The food was delicious and the place was beautiful. It overlooks the valley above the rice terraces and has a delightful ambience. They also have swings and although we had already done the swing, I thought this place was nicer. It was less crowded and offered similarly beautiful views. They also have a swimming pool for those interested in taking a dip.
review 3: We had a wonderful wedding anniversary lunch here with cocktails and the food was great (duck) as was the service. Our waitress asked if we were celebrating a special occassion and was kind enough to bring out a small dessert acknowleging our anniversary. The views are amazing! We didn't use the pool but some guests did take advantage of that perk.
review 4:
The food was pretty good, nothing special.
The views are phenomenal 😍. English is jot very well spoken by the staff, so it is preferable to use a translation app. Other than that, everything was super ! Definitely would give them a second visit in the future.
review 5:
A Disappointing Encounter at d’Alas Warung Amidst Beautiful Surroundings

Our excursion around the island led us to d’Alas Warung, a restaurant set against a backdrop of stunning vistas and the unique allure of giant swings. Yet, the enchanting environment was sharply contrasted by the chaos that greeted us upon arrival. The restaurant was far from bustling, yet the staff seemed overwhelmed, leading to a series of service missteps that began with being directed to a dirty table and continued with a lack of attention from the staff, reminiscent of absent-minded NPCs in a game.

After repeated efforts to gain service, we opted for simplicity in our order, hoping to avoid further complications. We chose the pizza Margherita and French fries for the children, Karins Style Chicken, and I selected the Lumpia. The pizzas were merely passable, not warranting a recommendation. The Lumpia, however, provided a solitary high point with its satisfying crispness and flavor. Regrettably, the Karins Style Chicken was a letdown; even the children rejected it, suggesting it was an overcooked relic rather than a meal.

Our drinks were a mixed bag; the margaritas, although visually appealing, failed to deliver on taste. In contrast, the orange juice and young coconut were fresh and enjoyable.

While the prices did not break the bank, the overall culinary experience left much to be desired. More than the food, it was the apparent disarray among the staff that marred our experience the most. The beautiful location of d’Alas Warung deserves a service level to match, and hopefully, this was just an off day that is not indicative of the usual standard.

name: Boni Bali Restaurant
address: Jl. Pakudui, Kedisan, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: What can I say! If you like Indonesian food and a chilled mass of tourist groups this place is for you! It is a beautiful location peaceful and tranquil 🙏🏼 the food is good and the staff could not be more accommodating.
review 2: I chose the Nasi Campur from the Balinese food selection and it was a fabulous choice! Taste the sides and mix all the ones you like in with the rice. The accompanying soup was delicious! We went during midday when it was clear so there was a great view of the nearby rice terrace (although other restaurants had a better view, after rice terrace hiking, I had enough of the rice terrace anyway).
review 3: You pay more for the demonstration of dishes than food itself. The rice terrace is hidden after coconut trees. The environment is great for eating.
review 4: Found a ant in my ice tea and some plastic. Their was a bug butterfly in the kitchen and the service was really long. The restaurant is not very clean and what about the koi pound.
review 5: Amazing place, great view, nice staff and delicious food.

name: Tirta sari
address: Jl. Pakudui, Kedisan, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: Super nice rooms, in a super nice spot. Quiet and beautiful. All the staff was awesome, so helpful and kind. We spent like 2 weeks here, enjoyed the pool, food, massages, view. Little out of the way, not much, just enough so it's quiet. 10 min moped ride away from main strip with all stores...
review 2: My girlfriend and I spent 3 weeks at Tirta Sari and it was the most blissful time of our Bali trip. The accommodation is amazing and even better than it looks in the pictures. You are right in the middle of amazing nature and beautiful rice fields which you can walk around. First and foremost the staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. They even made breakfast to take away for my gf every morning for yoga school. We will definitely come back on our next trip :)
review 3: Kind owner, nice staff too. Relaxing place. And reasonable price. Room layout is a bit odd, and somewhat old in places but it makes up for itself in other ways.
review 4: This place is a real hidden gem of Bali. Pictures that the hotel provides might not so attractive, but actually the scenery and service are the best in this area so far. At their pool, you will get the infinity greenery view and rice field like those expensive day clubs. Wayan and Ari were the best, staffs here are very helpful and extremely nice.
review 5:
A hidden gem . This place is perfect for relaxation. Perfect for couple or honeymooners. It’s just you and the nature . You can see and hear fire flies at night .
Away from the city life .

name: Rice field Tegallalang
address: Kedisan, Tegallalang, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80561, Indonesia

name: Hidden Valley Tunggir Bali
address: Kedisan, Tegallalang, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1:
Don’t go here, it’s closed!!!!! (Jan 2024).
We lost time trying to find it….

But close to it there is an Uma Ceking (7min), where you can do zip lines, swing, all that staff
review 2: hidden place in tegallalang to enjoy rice field, swing, flying fox, and many more. very recommend.
review 3: Beautiful rice terrace with an awesome view. Very hidden off the road, is a kilometer away from a gravel "parking lot", parking was not obvious and lucky we had a private guide ask the locals for directions. Recommended for the explorer as it's a gem away from the main road tourist traps without the coffee and souvenir shops.
review 4: Enjoyed the nature, got to see this beautifull place
review 5: Nice place. Private Location, full package. Include lunch welcome drink and cold towel is nice service. Low Price. Thanks hiddenvallerytunggir

name: Umah d'Alas
address: Jl. Raya Tegallalang, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: It has been such an amazing stay here, I only wish we had stayed here sooner or even longer. This 2 bedroom villa has more than you could ask for, and the staff is so incredibly helpful. Citra, you and your staff have outdone yourself and this is an experience we will remember forever. Thank you for accommodating us for one more child. Thank you for including breakfast to go for our early trip. Just the little details like staff finding a pool floaty for my child is so thoughtful. My most memorable day here is the floating breakfast and pool day with my family. THANK YOU!
review 2:
I've been to a lot of nice hotels such as in London, New York and Rio de Janeiro and none compares to the high level of customer service provideded here.

Shout out to Iluh and Wintari....the level of customer service these two offer is outstanding! Will be coming back for sure!
review 3:
What a great place.. heart in forest... All things in one place.. swing.. coffee plantation.. rice fields.. tree houses..awesome view.. floating breakfast.. amazing staff and the most important CHITRA(very loving and caring person..A 1 hospitality)
Love to be here again..
review 4:
We spend 3 nights in this fairyland with so much peace and joy. I love our private space, wooden house( room is very clean, with traditional decoration), swimming pool, kitchen n garden etc. I even spend one whole day here to do yoga .. meditation.. Beyond the door, you can enjoy the food in owner’s restaurant, chill in public swimming pool and walk besides rice field!
There’re 3 swings( single and couple ), I tried one the last day before check out, it was definitely one of my unforgettable experience in my life, I do love it!
And many many Thanks to dear Ms Citra, she’s so kind and caring during our stay, all staff are always ready to help us too.
Wish we could come back soon !
review 5: Happy to share the experience in umah d Alas stay , good place to stay and nice food to enjoy with view special thanks to Mrs Chita devi for wonderful stay

name: Swing road
address: H7GJ+9P6, Jl. Pakudui, Kedisan, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: A little further the touristic rice terraces. A little road that you can take by car/ bike lead you to this very calm and quiet place without all the touristic attractions around. Go there if you want to avoid the crowded rice terraces. And if you are lucky, the guys working there can have you a coconut, to drink while enjoying the view and worth the experience if you haven’t already try it!

name: VILLA HOKINA TEGALLALANG
address: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1:
The bed is comfort.. Clean.. And nice view.
All the staffs very friendly.. Hope next time, can go there again
review 2: a great place for relaxation, beautiful and calming ambiance, and artful indoor designs.
review 3:
I want come here again
So beautiful view 🥰🥰🥰🥰
review 4: Nice quite place for a little gateaway

name: d'Alas Swing
address: H7HH+4HW, Sebatu, Tegallalang, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: Why on earth has this place got such a low rating? It's amazing! The whole swing experience is by far the best in the area (others are available but not as high or picturesque) and the restaurant to enjoy lunch and a dip in the infinity pool nearby is stunning! I would highly recommend organising your trip here. We used Hire Bali Driver and Udi was the best - so friendly and knowledgeable. Not expensive at all if you ask me.
review 2: Great swing and really lovely people. The food in the restaurant was nice too and all the staff were so polite!
review 3:
Great experience and wonderful view!
But, make sure to sign the insurance paper before the swing! I was asked to do that only after the swing, I didn't know about that before..
review 4: Bali Swing for 200K, even when you eat in their resto is just robbery, if you ask me. And funny their explanation that for this excellent price you can swing 14x. 7x face front, 7x otherwise. Really? I do not think so...
review 5:
Brilliant. Do this when you’re in Bali!!
I screamed my lungs out and got some fab views of the rice terraces.
Excellent experience.

name: Tan Duren Warung Bali
address: H7HJ+C96, Jl. Pakudui, Kedisan, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: Delicious food. Local cuisine, loved it, thank you for cooking for us ♥️
review 2: We were there after the rice terraces and it was exactly what we were looking for ! Amazing delicious food and on the top they were so nice and friendly. The food is freshly made and we can totally recommend the mango fruit shake :) really 5 stars !
review 3: One of the worse food on Bali. Rice wasnt very good and their wifi wasnt working when we visited
review 4: A very cozy place with amazing authentic food! The owner is really nice and the food is prepared fresh and clean! Overall a great experience for anyone who wants to taste the local bali cuisine like nasi goreng
review 5: Food was good, lot of green around. Nice place 👌

name: Tropical Bali Sky Bike & Swing Adventure
address: H7GJ+VG2, Jl. Pakudui, Kedisan, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia

name: Villa Dani Ubud
address: H7FM+4CQ, Kedisan, Tegallalang, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1:
Amazing view....
Really make my eyes became so so....

name: Dapoer Sebatu
address: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: Their pork soup is so good, and the fried noodles I ordered were nice and spicy like I ordered. 😋 Hot orange juice was something I hadn't seen in many other places, but was surprisingly nice. Price 90k in total. 👌🏼
review 2: Friendly service. Good local selections on menu and reasonable price. Just outside tourist hussle of Tegallalang Rice Terraces. Very pleasant patio. Hot fresh food - enak!
review 4: Very very tasty food! The only thing I did not like is that despite they have more than 20 plates when I asked for they menu to see the prices they showed me a very reduced menu in english with a few plates. Look like they do not serve tourists same as locals... but finally I ordered Cap Cay with rice (wich was not in the reduced menu) and it was really good. They charged 31k for it.
review 5:
Great little place off the beaten path. Walkable to the famous rice terraces.

Not a ton of options, but All the prices were very reasonable. Mie & Nasi Goreng for 25k, chicken nuggets and fries for 30k, chicken sausage for 25k.

name: Warung Manik Kembang
address: Jalan Raya Pujung Kelod, H7FH+QGM, Tegallalalang, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia

name: Song landak bali
address: H7GH+5VM, Jl. Pakudui, Kedisan, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1:
Beautiful place where to have lunch. The view is fantastic and when I went there was nobody besides me and my partner.
The staff is super nice and the food good.

name: Pondok Van Bisma
address: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja No.51, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia

name: Warung Men Tunggir
address: Banjar Kebon Desa, Kedisan, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: Amazing View and  the Balinese Food was Delicious

name: Dadi Warung
address: Kedisan, Tegallalang, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80561, Indonesia
